3 years ago an oil slick polluted the River Lea. 
It exposed the lack of information given to people, putting them & the environment at greater risk.
So it was brilliant @EnvAgencySE set up alerts for serious incidents across North London.
It seems the service will end in March. https://t.co/zjb9gVFLUw

As hosts of #COP26, we're committed to protecting and restoring our natural environment.

urls.title: Guest post: How global warming is making power plants produce less electricity | Carbon Brief
urls.description: The coal, gas and nuclear power plants that generate most of the world‚Äôs electricity have to be kept cool in order to function properly. However, this will be increasingly challenging as the world gets warmer.

tweets.text:
Hot Drinks, Warm Clothes and Gloves essential ü•∂

The @EnvAgency #FieldTeam are maintaining flood defences, responding to incidents and protecting people from flooding in the rather cold conditions.

Report #Flooding, #Blockages or #Pollution to our 24/7 #ICS on 0800 08 70 60 https://t.co/rhPuDC6BPg

We received this video from a member of the public who lives at a marina on the great #Ouse

We have a couple of theories about what we think is in the waterü§î. Let us know what you think they are.

#Hertfordshire 
14.2.21 Defra Sandy monitor covering #Herts & #Beds has had no data available for PM2.5 #AirPollution for 39 days so far this year! 
It is now not measuring, please advise why?  @EnvAgency 
@DefraGovUK 
#AirPollution #AQMonitoring #Health https://t.co/BoNwieohEm
